info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 12 at 6:20PM EDT until August 12 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Rutherford County in western North Carolina... Cleveland County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... * Until 730 PM EDT. * At 620 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 11 miles southeast of Marion to 4 miles northeast of Forest City to 12 miles northwest of Gaffney, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Shelby, Kings Mountain, Boiling Springs NC, Belwood, Grover, Lawndale, Patterson Springs, Fallston, Polkville and Ellenboro. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
